review: The fire stick was out of stock on your site, so we went to Best Buy and found it there. brought it home hooked it up and it worked. It was easy to install and we have immediate results. We are very pleased with this purchase.
author: Sonya Goins

review: Being tech challenged the fire tv stick was easy to install.
author: Brenda Casci

review: I TRIED TO FIND APP FOR TIMEWARNER CABLE BUT WAS UNABLE TO FIND IT,I CALLED THE AMAZON HELP LINE AND FOUND OUT THAT THE FIRETV STICK DID NOT HAVE A APP FOR THIS.VERY DISAPPOINTED. I THINK ROKU STREAMING STICK IS A BETTER BUY AND SHOULD HAVE BOUGHT IT INSTEAD OF FIRE TV STICK ATLEASE THEY HAVE THIS APP.  THANK YOU

review: Bought this with the Sling promotion. Love it. Easy to use.

review: Love it!!!  Easy to move from room to room if need be.
author: Amazon Customer

review: The Fire TV Stick is a great idea that is well worth the price of the stick and the Amazon Prime subscription.  I did encounter problems at first because it would not stay connected to my wi-fi router.  Amazon tech support pleasantly surprised me when they called me within five minutes of my online request for help.  I spent several minutes on the phone with the first and second line support personnel unable to clear the problem.  The tech believed the cause was interference in my wireless environment and suggested I ask my ISP to set my router to a specific channel versus automatic mode.  After doing that, I continued to have slow connection and disconnect errors.  I finally moved my TV Stick to a different TV and it worked!.  I moved it back to the original TV but plugged it into a different HDMI port and that cured the problem.  Streaming is now strong and uninterrupted.  My TV is a 22" Seiko (a very off brand, I'm sure).  So...my advice to those who may encounter problems with the Stick is to try a different HDMI port or a different TV before even calling tech support.  Additionally, although the signals environment was not the cause of my problem, I found that there are some free apps out there for your smart phone or PC that will display your wi-fi environment to help you find sources of interference, e.g., "Acrylic Wi-Fi Free."
author: John Strathmore "John"
